data.description:
VRFS is a community-driven soccer (football) simulator with focus on realistic physics and competitive multiplayer.

Here are the main features of VRFS:

PHYSICS SIMULATION: Players can perform almost any trick, from balancing the ball on the tip of their foot to executing curved power shots and long passes. The ball's trajectory is solely determined by the physics engine.

COMPETITIVE MULTIPLAYER: The multiplayer architecture allows for instantaneous ball-touch response. For example, players can finish powerful crosses at the same speed as in real soccer. 

COMFORT: Players can move around using thumbsticks and play in either a seated or standing position. No intense hand movements are required.

NO PAY-TO-WIN in VRFS: Only skills matter. No one can buy 'stronger kicks' or 'faster boots.' Keep practicing, and you'll see improvement.

FREE FOR ALL: Players have full access to the game without needing to purchase anything. However, if you wish, you can buy cool equipment in the store to support the further development of this project.

Please keep in mind that VRFS is still in development, with upcoming upgrades to the physics and scenery. We'd appreciate your suggestions for any enhancements.

changelog.change_log: All recent VRFS updates

# PATCH-UPDATE 0.3.8

- Enhanced and fixed multiplayer sync 
(we're still looking for ways to make it better, and we appreciate your feedback)
- Major optimizations for custom arenas
- Fixed block colors in the arena editor
- Adjusted ball bouncing off walls in custom arenas
- Fixed issue with creating public lobbies from custom arena codes

# PATCH-UPDATE 0.3.8

- Enhanced and fixed multiplayer sync 
(we're still looking for ways to make it better, and we appreciate your feedback)
- Major optimizations for custom arenas
- Fixed block colors in the arena editor
- Adjusted ball bouncing off walls in custom arenas
- Fixed issue with creating public lobbies from custom arena codes

UPDATE 0.3.7

**Multiplayer:**
- Updated multiplayer sync to decrease lag time and address issues like ‘phasing’. This should also help with the problem of deflected balls appearing as goals, but we are still working on more complex enhancements. This feature is experimental and we appreciate your feedback.
- You can now use gloves after the goal is scored (this was highly requested).

**Scenes:**
- Added an enlarged version of the starting stadium with access to the stands and locker rooms.

**Camera mode:**
- Press grip to speed up (two grips to speed up faster).
- Press triggers to go up/down.
- Use camera mode in online public practice lobbies and in arena editing.

**Arena editor:**
- Added snap to grid feature.
- Place texts with adjustable size and color (up to 1,000 chars per instance).
- Most of the objects now have a ‘scale’ setting, thus allowing for resizing.
- Switch to camera mode when in the arena editor.

**Replays:**
- Share replay codes (and watch replays in the camera apps a bit later).
- Rewind / Fast-forward replays by pressing (A) and (X) on controllers.
- Slow-motion feature (press (A) + (X) on controllers).
- Increased smoothness of moving objects.

**Other:**
- Interface enhancements.
- Various fixes and optimizations in the in-game menu.
- Slightly improved sound effects.
- Some bugs were fixed 

**In-game store:**
- U19 Launch Bundle items removed from the store.
- New ‘Fun Kit’ bundle added, containing 12 items such as a golf ball, hockey puck, fitness ball, and more.

Announcement
Although the bundle is called 'Fun Kit,' its purpose goes beyond fun. It's part of our research, and the physics and features of these objects will evolve in the coming weeks.

UPDATE 0.3.6

While the team focuses on developing major new features, this patch is relatively small. Thank you for your patience as we prepare to roll out many cool things.

- Bug fixes (including the player mannequin not displaying custom jersey shorts and other issues)
- Improved multiplayer synchronization and goal tracking
- Minor UX enhancements
- New U19 bundles and the Botkeeper helmet in the store 

Additionally, you can now download replays on the player portal. However, the feature for sharing replay codes and play files is not yet available. You can still back up replays if needed.

UPDATE 0.3.5

INTRODUCING REPLAYS: 
Now you can record any multiplayer lobby as a replay, saved in the cloud. Replays capture the position and behavior of all objects and players and can be viewed in the headset’s camera mode (you can watch it flying around the scene). Unlike video recording, replays don’t use heavy hardware resources, so no lags or extra battery drain. 

Find the Replays icon at the top of the menu. Replays are currently in beta, with features like auto-saving goals, sharing replays, and stadium screen replays coming soon.

MEET THE NEW BRAND “U19”:
U19 designers are creating extra detailed cosmetics with unique, slightly futuristic concepts. The brand is launching with a limited offer of three bundles, each consisting of six items. All items are also available for single purchase.

OTHER ENHANCEMENTS:
- Fixed minor bugs, such as players sometimes appearing in a white t-shirt.
- Potentially removed lag when other players were switching between custom jerseys or entering the lobby. 
- Fixed the ball rotation sync (previously appeared to rotate slower when kicked by other players). 
- Fixed the ball slightly teleporting when entering the goals.
- Fixed lag when scrolling through custom arena lists.


Thank you all for playing VRFS. We are already working on more enhancements and features.

UPDATE 0.3.4

Custom arenas now have auto generated cover images

Private lobby creators can kick and block players 
(vote kicks for pubs coming in later updates) 

The camera now disappears when it is too close to the player

Slightly enhanced ball bouncing physics

Botkeepers are available in every arena in private lobbies

Fixed some store items following community feedback (but probably not all of them just yet)

Fixed known bugs and issues (bugs related to camera mode, rules were sometimes triggered randomly, game loading issues, and more)

Increased net physics response (still working on enhancing nets).

More things are in production and testing and will be released soon. Thanks for staying tuned.
